That the expression, \93bottomless pit,\94 represents the earth in a state of confusion and darkness, is evident from other scriptures. Concerning the condition of the earth \93in the beginning,\94 the Bible record says that it \93was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep.\94 [GENESIS 1:2; THE WORD HERE TRANSLATED \93DEEP\94 IS THE SAME THAT IN REVELATION 20:1-3 IS RENDERED \93BOTTOMLESS PIT."] 
659
Prophecy teaches that it will be brought back, partially, at least, to this condition. Looking forward to the great day of God, the prophet Jeremiah declares: \93I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was without form, and void; and the heavens, and they had no light. I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly. I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled. I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful place was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down.\94 [Jeremiah 4:23-27.]
